column4: are you able to boot to black screen and change the terminal?
yeah, but can't make anything out
they're all corrupt
root hdd full? Do you use proprietery driver for nvidia?
no, still got a few gb free on root drive
i believe so, yes
i got problems with driver after upgrade to new kernel. try to install the nvidia driver of the factory site via teminal
i tried previous 3 kernels too though, same issue
yeah same issue here ..after install the factory driver it was working
link?
just a moment please
which card?
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation NV44A [GeForce 6200] (rev a1)
try this http://www.nvidia.com/content/DriverDownload-March2009/confirmation.php?url=/XFree86/Linux-x86/256.44/NVIDIA-Linux-x86-256.44.run&lang=us&type=GeForce
thune3: thanks. will give this a go
i chose a series 6 driver...i guess GeForce 6200 is included
well if i can even get in, i can search for the right one if it doesn't work
ok
thune3, shane2peru: woo! fixed. removed 'splash' and 'vga=791' from kernel line and it worked. splash so i could see if there were any probs, where it halted. i think the vga did the trick
cool
